snippet: Jean-Luc Mélenchon draws large, passionate crowds, and with a field of 10, candidates of both the far right and left gain clout.
abstract: Far-left French presidential candidate Jean-Luc Melenchon draws large, passionate crowds, and he is running just ahead of far-right candidate Marine Le Pen just two weeks in advance of the first round of voting; with a field of 10, the candidates of both extremes have been gaining clout.

byline.original: By MAÏA de la BAUME and STEVEN ERLANGER

lead_paragraph: Jean-Luc Mélenchon draws large, passionate crowds, and with a field of 10, candidates of both the far right and left gain clout.

headline.seo: In French Elections, Sound and Fury From the Left’s Mélenchon
headline.main: In French Vote, Sound and Fury From the Left
headline.print_headline: In French Vote, Sound And Fury From the Left
